intro: Korthalsella geminata, commonly known as the twin-leaved korthalsia, is a small flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or wooded areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
